com.mapdigit.gis.vector
Class MapFeatureLayer

java.lang.Object
  com.mapdigit.gis.vector.MapFeatureLayer

public final class MapFeatureLayer
extends java.lang.Object

MapLayer defines a map layer.Computer maps are organized into layers. Think of the layers as transparencies that are stacked on top of one another. Each layer contains different aspects of the entire map. Each layer contains different map objects, such as regions, points, lines and text.

© Copyright 2009 Guidebee Pty Ltd. All Rights Reserved.

Constant Field Values

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FEATURE_TYPE_REGION

public static final int FEATURE_TYPE_REGION
Predominant feature type is region.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

autoLabel

public boolean autoLabel
This property controls whether a layer is automatically labeled. In order for a label to be displayed automatically, its centroid must be within the viewable map area. This is a Boolean value, and its default is true.

fontColor

public int fontColor
font color.

bounds

public GeoLatLngBounds bounds
A Rectangle object representing the geographic extents (i.e., the minimum bounding rectangle) of all objects in the layer.

dataTable

public DataTable dataTable
The tabular data table object associated with this map layer.

keyField

public DataField keyField
This string property identifies the column (field) name in the layer's tabular table that will be the name property of a feature object. It currently defaults to the first column in the layer's table or the column with name as "Name" if there is any.

predominantFeatureType

public int predominantFeatureType
Predominant feature type. can be POINT,PLINE or REGION.

visible

public boolean visible
Is this map layer visible.

description

public java.lang.String description
Description for this mapLayer.

zoomLevel

public boolean zoomLevel
This controls whether the layer is zoom layered. Zoom layering controls the range of zoom levels (distance across map) for which the layer is displayed. If Zoom Layering is on, then the values stored in the zoomMax and zoomMin properties are used. This is a Boolean value, and the default is false.

zoomMax

public double zoomMax
If ZoomLayering is on (zoomLevel=true), then this specifies the maximum zoom value for which a layer will be drawn on the map. This takes a double value specifying distance in Map units (Map.mapUnit).

zoomMin

public double zoomMin
If ZoomLayering is on (zoomLevel=true), then this specifies the minimum zoom value for which a layer will be drawn on the map. This takes a double value specifying distance in Map units (Map.MapUnit).
